definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
endocrine gland/gland producing internal secretion, e.g. hormone

sentences.english: Objective To explore effects of residues of organochlorine pesticides on reproductive endocrine in human.

sentences.english: There can be endocrine problems that come about, particularly with radiation to the brain.

sentences.english: Sometimes, several endocrine cells were found on one glandular tube.

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effects of chemo-endocrine therapy on gastric carcinoma (GC).
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察胃癌患者化學內分泌治療的效果。

sentences.english: Conclusion: Small cell neuroendocrine carcinoma is rare neoplasms of the breast.

sentences.chinese: 內分泌學家也會檢查不同的激素水平。

sentences.english: May adjust the endocrine disorders, will maintain the bowel movement unobstructed will reduce the mammary gland painfully swollen.

sentences.english: Mullein is a great herb for the endocrine glandular system especially the thyroid.

sentences.english: Regulation of the endocrine, balance hormones, improve sub-health, anti-aging.

definition: to nurse one's health/to recuperate/to take care of/to look after/to discipline/to educate/to train/to prepare food/(dialect) to make fun of/(medicine) to opsonize
to adjust/to regulate/to harmonize/to reconcile (accountancy etc)
imbalance/to become dysfunctional/to lack proper care (after an illness etc)
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
